text: Abassia Rahmani (born 2 July 1992) is a Swiss Paralympic athlete of Algerian descent who competes in international sprinting events. She was a very keen and active person who had a huge interest in snowboarding, gymnastics, horse riding and track and field. When Rahmani was sixteen, she had both of her legs amputated due to bacterial meningitis but continued her passion in athletics and tried out Paralympic athletics. ==References== Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Zürich Category:People from Winterthur Category:Swiss people of Algerian descent Category:Paralympic athletes of Switzerland Category:Swiss female sprinters Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Paralympics
title: Abassia Rahmani
